name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Orlando Lake Buena Vista

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at this hotel a few weeks before Christmas. We had planned to stay only 6 nights; however, my children and I came down with the flu a few days after arriving. We were so sick, we were unable to leave our room. We added an additional 4 nights onto our trip (until we were cleared to fly). The staff was SO NICE about everything (our changing plans, keeping popsicles for our kids, cleaning up after our violently ill 5-yr-olds, etc...). When they realized how sick we were, housekeeping brought a huge tray of juices for our kids, and staff asked everyday how we were doing or if they could help with anything. Carlos, Jen, and Rafael were especially friendly and wonderful to talk to. Yes, the hotel rooms are nice, it's really close to the parks, and the breakfast is great, but what really makes this hotel wonderful are the employees.
reviews.title: The Staff are Exceptional

reviews.text: I stayed for 12 nights in Dec 2012 with my 3 kids. This is my 1st visit to Orlando.
reviews.title: Free wifi, free hot breakfast, free shuttle to Epcot only

reviews.text: The wifi in the hotel room has a really strong signal, and very fast download speed too.
reviews.title: Not Impressed
Best FairField Inn Experience Ever
reviews.text: The breakfast spread is great - waffles, toast bread, oat porridge, hamburgers, yogurt, fruit cups, fresh bananas, scrambled eggs & meat patties, coffee & tea, fruit juice, milk, a variety of corn flakes. But go before 9am, if you want bananas because they run out after that time.
The theme park free shuttle goes only to Epcot. Disney provides free connecting shuttles from Epcot to the other Disney theme parks.
reviews.title: Best Free wi-fi I have ever experienced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here two nights early December in a 1 bedroom King Suite. Everything in the suite was spotless, well arranged and inviting. Quiet and efficient a/c-heating, comfortable King bed, and dustless furniture. Had requested an early check in with extra towels on a high floor and everything was ready for our arrival. Room was on the mall side but there was no traffic noise. Parking was not a problem and although right next to a strip mall did not feel unsafe even returning late at night.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable, Convienent and Completely Enjoyable

reviews.text: Breakfast was normal for a Fairfield Inn and the dinning attendants made sure everything was available, refilling hot foods, breads, coffee (which was not the usually weak variety but rather full bodied), fruits and other offerings as soon as needed. Tables were cleaned as soon as they were vacated and the entire area was very welcoming.
reviews.title: Great value and nice service
Great hotel for Disney
reviews.text: Drove to Mt. Dora the first night, (about 35 minutes) and used the FREE shuttle to Epcot the next day. Shuttle runs numerous times each day and the last one back at night from Epcot was at 10:30Pm so you could watch the closing fireworks and still make the bus.
Restaurants, food markets and drugstores all conveniently located nearby.
reviews.title: My experience with my first stay at a Fairfield Inn

reviews.text: With great accommodations, superb, friendly and customer focused staff, hot breakfast and free shuttle, no reason to stay anywhere else when visiting the area.
reviews.title: Nicely refurbished, convenient to Disney World

reviews.text: I had planned on taking my four children to Disney since this past summer. Originally, I had booked to stay at Disney World in a suite. But the more I researched the experience of staying at Disney, the less appealing it became to me.
reviews.title: One Mother and Four Children going to Disney!
Near to downtown Disney
reviews.text: I realized that I did not want to stay in a large oversized resort, dealing with crowds of screaming toddlers at breakfast. Nor did I want us to be packed into Disney buses like a head of cattle. I came to realize that the whole Disney experience may not be as "magical" as it was perceived on television.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, I turned to Tripadvisor to find a hotel outside of the Disney resorts. But how to choose a hotel from over the 300 listed? I read each hotel review, and decided to make a reservation at this Fairfield for a number of reasons. Firstly, I was impressed by the photos of the modern and clean areas of the hotel. I was also equally impressed by the individual responses to each review on Tripadvisor that had been left by Mr. Lower, the General Manager of the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have four children aged 15, 13, 12 and 9. Upon arrival at Orlando International, we picked up our rented minivan and had a short 25 minute drive to the hotel. Upon arrival, our rooms (one double queen and one king) were not ready as we had arrived early in the morning. We left our bags with Carlos at the hotel and headed over to Epcot. We spent the day at Epcot, and stayed for the firework show which closed the park. When we left Epcot, we saw the Disney Resort guests lining up in long lines to board their buses. As I had suspected, the buses were being crammed full of people. I was already happy with the choice of not staying at a Disney Resort. We climbed into our minivan and had a fifteen minute drive back to the hotel. The Disney buses can take much longer to get to their resorts, not to mention the additional time to get to your room once you arrive at the resort.
reviews.title: This is a wonderful hotel.

reviews.text: We parked easily, and checked into our rooms. The rooms were magnificent in every detail. Modern, spacious, and impeccably clean, and trust me I look carefully. We climbed into beds which were clean, fresh and extremely comfortable. I was thinking that night about the rooms at Disney's Art of Animation, where the table turns into a bed, and was so thankful to be sleeping in such comfortable surroundings.
reviews.title: Pretty Good Hotel

reviews.text: A couple of friends and I stayed here while visiting Disney World. Overall I was pleased with the hotel. The staff were fantastic, really friendly and helpful. There are a few restaurants right next door to the hotel - I didn't have time to try them though. There's a free shuttle to Disney. There was a fridge in the room, too, which was very useful to have. Free wi-fi too.
reviews.title: Good for Disney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downsides were really minor. There wasn't a safe in the room; reception has locked deposit boxes but they're wallet-sized so you can't lock up your laptop. We left ours with reception but I'd rather have access to a safe. Also, the shuttle bus doesn't run at the best times - the first one leaves at 8.45am, which sounds OK, but by the time you've taken the shuttle followed by another bus, a boat or a monorail (depending on which park you're going to) you're there more like 10 or 10.30, which means you can't skip the queues by beating the rush.
reviews.title: Good value & location
Good value for the price
reviews.text: Those minor things aside, this is a nice hotel and I'd happily stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first time for us staying at a Fairfield inn, but we have stayed at lots of Marriott properties in the past. Fairfield Inns are a grade below the Courtyards or the Residence Inns it seems. We did stay here due to the fact that my Marriott Visa gives me a yearly free night at a level 4 or below.
reviews.title: Great Weekend Getaway!

reviews.text: Bottom line, this hotel is fine and has all the basics. quiet room, good a/c with a fan only option, comfortable beds, nice HD flat screen, friendly staff.
reviews.title: Family Vacation
